name: Hale Huanani Bed and Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed in the cottage for a week. Everything was outstanding! The breakfast in the morning was very good. The bread that was made fresh daily was extremely good! What was really nice with this BB was you got the feeling that you were a local. We first got in on Wednesday afternoon and went straight to the house. After getting settled in we just took it easy that afternoon. It was not until the next morning we went into Kihei to go to the beach and we relized that we avoided all the tourist!! Which was really nice for us, plus it is super quite!! Unless you don't like listening to the birds in the morning, this place is a must!!
reviews.title: Great Week!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Susan took the time to sit down with us when we first got there and showed us the island on a map. Gave us ideas for do's and don'ts and gave us ideas for shopping and eating. The cottage was extremely clean and organized. Coming from Phoenix, AZ, not having AC was a little stressful before we got there. But after the first night, it was no big deal. The wind stays steady and keeps the cottage comfortable. For the cost of this place vs other places in Kihei you are getting a great deal!!
reviews.title: Great stay in Maui

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The owners really make sure you are taken care and respect your privacy too. Overall, I would reccommend this to anyone going to Kihei that wants privacy and a nice place to stay. We will be back!!
reviews.title: perfect hillside retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 4 nights at Hale Huanani from 2/27 to 3/2. We stayed in the Niu Suite and everything was great. Very quiet for sleeping, very spacious with combination sleeping and living area. Good ventilation and fans (no air conditioning which is normal as electric kwh is very expensive). Great shower in bathroom, full closet with tons of extra towels including stuff for the beach. Good size refrigerator in kitchen and had a microwave, sink, plenty of dishes. Fresh fruit and a baked Hawaiian bread for muffins were placed on the patio each morning at 7 am. They were yummy. A basket full of macadamia nuts and a nut cracker treated us with fresh nuts when we needed a snack. You need a car here, you are about 1.5 miles up the hill from Wailea village. Best snorkeling is down in Makena - not sandy beaches there but you can get in off the lava without getting hurt and there are turtles and great fish. Susan has chairs, mats, boogie boards, coolers so you don't have to bring that stuff from home. We had happy hour at the Fairmont one night - great sunset and whale view. This B&B is really a value - I told Susan that I thought she was not charging enough for what she was delivering. I walked in the morning in the Maui Meadows neighborhood and it was very safe and everyone I passed said hello. Susan gave us her ideas for what not to miss on the island, where to snorkel and where to eat. Also we just chatted about other stuff as well and she is very approachable and an outstanding hostess. We ate at da Kitchen in Kihei and Five Palms in Kihei, both very good. Did an early bike trip out of Haleakala but did not see sunrise due to cloud cover. Did a whale watch out of Lahaina and had great whale sitings. Spent 4 nights in Molokai and that was a whole other story - very worthwhile to go over there but it is a place stopped in time about 50 years ago. All in all, a great value stay - we have always stayed in the Wailea resorts but those are so expensive and you pay extra for every single thing plus the resort fees and taxes. The only thing we missed was the ocean view but we had plenty of that in what we did on the island so it was worth it to save the money.
reviews.title: Nice place, but a big "beware"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 2 separate times for a total of a week- read the reviews they are spot on!
reviews.title: Beautiful & clean- A+++++!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were in Maui, Hawaii in Nov 2011 when we stayed at this Bed and Breakfast in Kihei. I wasn't really sure about this initially when my husband booked this place, but you bet he had done his research. The lady seemed very friendly and polite thorough the email exchanges that we had. And after meeting her in person i felt the warmth and helping nature.The first morning she greeted us and gave us good tips about what to do around the area which was extremely useful (including travel books, maps and CDs about Maui). But what impressed me most was that the room was stocked with everything you could possibly imagine, most of the items you'll never find in any B&B. All in all an excellent place to stay, affordable, comfortable and excellent location (we travelled throughout Maui from this B&B). I highly recommend this place to everybody, best i've ever stayed in.
reviews.title: Best B&B that we ever stayed in

reviews.text: Rather than stay at a hotel it is always a treat to find an out of the way b&b that is priced right and gives you the feel of being in a park. This b&b is located in a subdivision high up from Kihei Town but is only 3 miles from a major supermarket and the beach. It has just 3 rooms but from sunrise to sunset you hear nothing but birds and occasionally voices of nearby residents. No a/c needed but there is plenty of flow through ventilation, ceiling fan, washer/dryer access (free), great continental breakfast (fruit and freshly baked muffins), a manager who gives you your privacy. The room has cable TV and DVR, frig, microwave and outside table and chairs from which you can relax and enjoy breakfast and the surroundings. Hale Huanani (house of beautiful fruit) lives up to its name and I highly recommend it but not for people with kids.
reviews.title: A private and peaceful experience on Maui
Awesome!
reviews.text: We stayed at the Manako Cottage...everything was fantastic! The freshly baked bread and fruit for breakfast, the full kitchen + utensils, complimentary beach gear (chairs, towels, boogie boards, parasols, coolers etc), an awesome garden and Susan herself, a friendly and helpful host. Best of all was the house cat, Mike (we called him Tama.) He seemed to like to hang out with us, there were times when he was waiting in the driveway for us to come home.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Definitely the place to stay in Kihei.
reviews.title: Fantastic B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great B&B to stay at. There are many more amenities than Susan lists on her website. She bakes some delicious homemade bread and fruits every morning. There are coolers, beach chairs, towels, boogie boards and more for use while staying there. She even let us check out and shower after our checkout and before our redeye flight. Location is not on the beach but a secure residential area which was no problem. If you want great beach access, check the expensive Wilea hotels and pay many times more. This is a great deal!
reviews.title: A gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Susan and Chuck offer all the comforts of home without any of the work, We stayed in the cottage and loved everything about it. The neighborhood is peaceful and quiet; morning walkers all greet you as their guest as well. Fruit and baked goodies were delivered to our lanai table every morning next to a lovely table setting--- Susan has the most lovely collection of tropical dishes---- and a full bag of Maui coffee allowed me to make a pot early each day and satisfy my habit!
reviews.title: Home away from home, but better!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The collection of beach and picnic items along with the price washer,dryer and grill allowed you to take care of any laundry and cook your own meals as you wished.
reviews.title: Custom Facilities, well managed

reviews.text: The house cat as mentioned by others is adorable and gave us many good laughs!
reviews.title: Best value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highly recommend this warm and inviting B&B....and a fantastic value on top of all that!
reviews.title: Nice for divers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The home was custom build to include B&B facilities, which are very well designed. Directions from airport to B&B were excellent. Loan of county of Maui map very helpful for a driving vacation. Susan was very helpful in explaining opportunities and locations for our five night stay. Referral to Lu'au was excellently chosen.
reviews.title: Quiet, pleasant retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiancé and I stayed at Hale Huanani Dec 3rd-9th for part of our Maui vacation and we are wishing we would have booked longer! Susan provides everything you need for the beach (umbrella, fresh towels daily, beach chairs and boogie boards). We appreciated the glad ware so we could pack our lunches for the beach daily! Breakfasts were such a treat (the fruit was wonderful) and we loved the Maui coffee. Staying in a residential area was a great way to see another side of Maui. My fiancé, Ben and I enjoyed running around the area in morning, looking at all the beautiful houses and flowers. My very favorite thing about the Hale Huanani was Susan's cat, "Big Kitty". We snuggled with him every night. All in all, the Hale Huanani is a gem. I felt lucky to have stayed in such a beautiful location and to have saved many pennies instead of staying at a hotel. If you're looking for a quiet, romantic vacation on a budget, this is your place! Thanks Susan. We will be back!
reviews.title: Best Deal in Maui!

reviews.text: ~Megan & Ben, Minneapolis Minnesota.
reviews.title: Special touch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ditto the comments of previous reviewers. Special touches in decor, place settings and breakfasts - even home made pumpkin bread on Thanksgiving. We will make one suggestion. Although we did meet and socialize with the couple in the other studio, unlike many B&B's, the separate eating areas (a guest cottage will open soon) and the owner's demeanor don't encourage interactions.
reviews.title: Fantastic room, wonderful place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of the best rooms I've stayed in, ever. The bed is so comfortable, I want to get one for house, I mean, I generally don't sleep well my first night in a new place, not a problem here. The decor is tasteful, Hawai'ian but not kitschy. The room is spacious, and refined. There's a well stocked bathroom, linen closet and kitchenette, plus access to the laundry, free use of all kinds of beach gear, an interesting garden to walk around, a very quiet neighborhood and a reasonably convenient location. Breakfast (Maui doesn't allow B&B's to provide hot food or dairy, apparently) was scrumptious. Susan, the proprietor, is friendly and incredibly responsive.
reviews.title: A great B&B and excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's not on the beach. It doesn't have a grand vista. But the room is far, far nicer than most any hotel room that is, and is a very small fraction of the price of those few that are.
reviews.title: “Beautiful house/room and good jumping off point”

description: Our B&B is in a very quiet, safe, residential neighborhood in south Maui where average rainfall is 12-1/2 inches per year. We are only a 5-minute drive to the closest beach (Keawakapu Beach) and a 5-minute drive to the most beautiful outdoor world-class shopping mall in Maui (The Shops at Wailea).
